Description: Fully preserved Chian 'bobbin' pottery transport amphora with decoration consisting of simple bands and 'volutes' on the shoulder. Large dipinto mark on body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Petrie gives an arrow shaped dipinto in his drawing. This is not clearly visible on the pot, where there are 'clear' original suraces among some darker deposit.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.006)
